Package msoe.swe2721.lab4_5

Class InventoryManager

java.lang.Object
msoe.swe2721.lab4_5.InventoryManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
InventoryManagerInterface
public class InventoryManager extends Object implements InventoryManagerInterface
This class will realize the interface which is responsible for keeping track of inventory.

  • Method Details

    • addNewItemToStore

      public void addNewItemToStore(String name, String description, int sku, double price) throws DuplicateItemEntryException, InvalidInventoryParameterException, InvalidSKUException
      This method will add a new item to the store. The item must have a unique SKU and all other parameters must also be valid.
      Specified by:
      addNewItemToStore in interface InventoryManagerInterface
      Parameters:
      name - This is the name of them item. It must be at least two characters in length after trimming any leading and trailing spaces.
      description - This is the description of the item. This store requires this to be at least 10 characters in length, though no changes are made.
      sku - This is the sku for the item. It should be unique amongst all sku's.
      price - This is the price of the item. It must be positive and less than or equal to $1000 for this store to list.
      Throws:
      InvalidInventoryParameterException - This exception will be thrown if any parameter is out of range.
      DuplicateItemEntryException - This exception will be thrown if the SKU already exists within the system.
      InvalidSKUException - This exception will be thrown is the KSU itself is not a valid SKU.

    • addNewItemToStore

      public void addNewItemToStore(String name, String description, int sku, double price, int initialStock) throws InvalidInventoryParameterException, DuplicateItemEntryException, InvalidSKUException
      This method will add a new item to the store. The item must have a unique SKU and all other parameters must also be valid.
      Specified by:
      addNewItemToStore in interface InventoryManagerInterface
      Parameters:
      name - This is the name of them item. It must be at least two characters in length after trimming any leading and trailing spaces.
      description - This is the description of the item. This store requires this to be at least 10 characters in length, though no changes are made.
      sku - This is the sku for the item. It should be unique amongst all sku's.
      price - This is the price of the item. It must be positive and less than or equal to $1000 for this store to list.
      initialStock - This is the initial stock. It must be positive.
      Throws:
      InvalidInventoryParameterException - This exception will be thrown if any parameter is out of range.
      DuplicateItemEntryException - This exception will be thrown if the SKU already exists within the system.
      InvalidSKUException - This exception will be thrown is the KSU itself is not a valid SKU.

    • checkForSKUInSystem

      public boolean checkForSKUInSystem(int sku) throws InvalidSKUException
      This method will determine if a SKU is present in the system.
      Specified by:
      checkForSKUInSystem in interface InventoryManagerInterface
      Parameters:
      sku - This si the sku number. Must be positive.
      Returns:
      true if the sku is in the system. False if not.
      Throws:
      InvalidSKUException - will be thrown if the sku is not a valid sku.

    • obtainItemBySKU

      public InventoryItem obtainItemBySKU(int sku) throws InvalidSKUException
      This method will obtain the inventory item associated with a given sku.
      Specified by:
      obtainItemBySKU in interface InventoryManagerInterface
      Parameters:
      sku - This is the inventory sku.
      Returns:
      The return will be the inventory item or null if the item does not exist.
      Throws:
      InvalidSKUException - will be thrown if the sku is not a valid sku.

    • addStock

      public int addStock(int sku, int newStockReceived) throws InvalidSKUException
      This method will add new stock into the inventory.
      Specified by:
      addStock in interface InventoryManagerInterface
      Parameters:
      sku - This is the sku that is to have inventory added. Must be positive.
      newStockReceived - This is the count of the new stock that has been received. Must be positive.
      Returns:
      The return will be the total stock of the items after the stock has been added.
      Throws:
      InvalidSKUException - This will be thrown if the SKU is invalid.
      InvalidParameterException - This will be thrown if the new stock received is invalid (i.e. negative)

    • returnStock

      public int returnStock(int sku, int returnedStockCount) throws InvalidSKUException
      This method will return stock that has been sold back to inventory when it is returned.
      Specified by:
      returnStock in interface InventoryManagerInterface
      Parameters:
      sku - This is the sku that is to have inventory returned. Must be positive.
      returnedStockCount - This is the count of the new stock that has been received. Must be positive.
      Returns:
      The return will be the total stock of the items after the stock has been returned.
      Throws:
      InvalidSKUException - This will be thrown if the SKU is invalid.
      InvalidParameterException - This will be thrown if the new stock received is invalid (i.e. negative)
